properties.name: --vpx-demo
properties.description: Example property using vpx units. Use vpx, maxvpx, minvpx, cvpx for viewport-based sizing, or linear-vpx() for fluid responsive values.

values.name: vpx
values.description: Viewport pixel unit - converts to vw based on viewport width. Example: 36vpx → 9.6vw (375px viewport)

values.name: maxvpx
values.description: Viewport pixel with minimum bound - converts to max(vw, Npx). Example: 36maxvpx → max(9.6vw, 36px)

values.name: minvpx
values.description: Viewport pixel with maximum bound - converts to min(vw, Npx). Example: 36minvpx → min(9.6vw, 36px)

values.name: cvpx
values.description: Clamped viewport pixel - converts to clamp(minPx, vw, maxPx). Example: 36cvpx → clamp(36px, 9.6vw, 36px)

values.name: linear-vpx()
values.description:
Linear interpolation for fluid responsive design.

Syntax:
- linear-vpx(minValue, maxValue, minViewportWidth, maxViewportWidth)
- linear-vpx(minValue, maxValue) - uses default viewport range

Example: linear-vpx(840, 1000, 1200, 1920) → clamp(840px, calc(...), 1000px)
